items.title: Slower-growing species promote interspecific cooperation and coexistence under acid stress through cross-feeding
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67395-z Acid stress is an environmental factor shaping the structure and function of microbial communities. Here, the authors show that microbial interspecific interactions are highly dynamic during acid stress changes. They find slow-growing species promote population cooperation and coexistence under elevated acid stress.

items.title: Visualizing insecticide control of insect TRP channel function and assembly
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67287-2 The heteromeric insect TRPV channel, Nanchung-Inactive, is a previously structurally uncharacterized insecticide target. Here, Fedor et al. provide insights into how an insecticide and a natural agonist modulate channel behavior, paving the way for future insecticide development.

items.title: Glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist in large vessel occlusion treated by reperfusion therapy—a phase 2 randomized trial
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66167-z Semaglutide, a GLP-1 receptor agonist, may offer neuroprotective benefits after stroke, but its effects in large vessel occlusion (LVO) are unknown. Here the authors show, in a phase 2 randomized trial, that semaglutide is safe after endovascular therapy and may improve recovery in patients not receiving intravenous thrombolysis.

items.title: Flexible robotic hand harnesses large deformations for full-coverage human-like multimodal haptic perception
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67148-y While visual-tactile sensors promise high perception resolution at low cost, they often sacrifice compliance to maintain optical stability, hindering non-planar contact perception. The authors present FlexiRay, a soft gripper merging visual-tactile sensing with a compliant Fin Ray structure.

items.title: All-optical hybrid metasurfaces for ultrafast computational spectrometer and single-pixel imaging
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67605-8 A hybrid metasurface functioning as a low-correlation and ultrafast spectral/spatial light modulator is demonstrated for all-optical THz computational spectrometer and single pixel imaging replacing mechanical delay lines and coherent detection.

items.title: Structural characterisation of the fungal Pmt4 homodimer
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67412-1 PMTs are fungal O-mannosyltransferases embedded in the ER membrane. Here, structures of the Pmt4 homodimer reveal distinct features of this PMT family and uncover an additional cytosolic binding site for the Dol-P-Man substrate lipid.

items.title: The microRNA miR-71 suppresses maladaptive UPR<sup>mt</sup> signaling through both cell-autonomous and cell-non-autonomous mechanisms
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67198-2 Mitochondria play roles in sensing environmental and physiological stress, but their response can become maladaptive during chronic stress. Here they identify a protective miRNA response in C. elegans that maintains tissue health by attenuating mitochondrial stress signaling.

items.title: Targeting LRBA triggers CTLA4 degradation and antitumor immunity for cancer immunotherapy
items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 14 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67365-5 LRBA deficiency is associated with autoimmune disease and CTLA4 loss; this study identifies LRBA as a negative regulator of antitumor immunity and introduces LC427 as a promising small-molecule inhibitor of the CTLA4-LRBA interaction for cancer immunotherapy.
